fr.sii.ogham.sms.message

Class Sms

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.sms.message.Sms
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HasContentFluent<Sms>, HasRecipients<Recipient>, HasRecipientsFluent<Sms,Recipient>, HasToFluent<Sms>, Message, Loggable

    public class Sms
extends Object
implements Message, HasContentFluent<Sms>, HasRecipients<Recipient>, HasRecipientsFluent<Sms,Recipient>, HasToFluent<Sms>, Loggable
    SMS message that contains the following information:
    • The content of the SMS (see Content and sub classes for more information)
    • The sender information (name and phone number). Name is optional
    • The list of recipients (name and phone number). Name is optional
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

      • content

        public Sms content(Content content)
        Set the content of the message.

        You can use this method to explicitly set a particular Content instance. For example: 

         
 .content(new TemplateContent("path/to/template", obj));

        If you prefer, you can instead use the fluent API to set the message of the SMS: 

         
 .message().template("path/to/template", obj)
        Specified by:
        content in interface HasContentFluent<Sms>
        Parameters:
        content - the content of the message
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining
        See Also:
        message()

      • content

        public Sms content(String content)
        Set the content of the message. This is a shortcut to 
          .content(new StringContent(content))

        If you prefer, you can instead use the fluent API to set the message of the SMS: 

         
 .message().string(content)
        Specified by:
        content in interface HasContentFluent<Sms>
        Parameters:
        content - the content of the message
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining
        See Also:
        message()

      • message

        public SingleContentBuilder<Sms> message()
        Set the message of the SMS.

        This method provides fluent chaining to guide developer. It has the same effect has using content(Content).

        If you also call either content(Content), content(String) or setContent(Content) then this method has no effect.

        Returns:
        the builder for building text part
        Since:
        3.0.0
